discussion.author: pi8027
discussion.comment:
@CohenCyril Thank you for the response. I tried to fix as you requested but didn't get satisfactory results on the following lemmas. I need to do some trial and error and think that the first one can be elegantly proved if `orderType` instances for `itv_bound` are provided. So may I contribute them as another PR after we finished #270?

```
Lemma itv_intersectionE (x : R) (i1 i2 : interval R) :
  x \in itv_intersection i1 i2 = (x \in i1) && (x \in i2).

Lemma itv_intersection3E (i1 i2 i3 : interval R) :
  exists x y, pred3 i1 i2 i3 x /\ pred3 i1 i2 i3 y /\
              itv_intersection i1 (itv_intersection i2 i3) =
              itv_intersection x y.
```

Your comment on the statement of `itv_intersection3E` looks good to me. I'd like to try that. :)
